subject: Entrepreneurship
title: The Power of Small Batches
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Power of Small Batches.

hook.text: A Stanford experiment asked people to fold, stuff, and stamp newsletters. One at a time beat batching.

buildup.text: Common sense says do all the folding first, then all the stuffing. It feels more efficient.

discovery.text: Small batches finish faster because you catch errors immediately instead of at the end.

twist.text: Toyota builds cars in small batches. They can spot a defect in minutes, not weeks.

climax.text: Lean startups ship tiny updates constantly, catching failures before they multiply into disasters.

punchline.text: Ship small. Fail small. Learn fast.

quiz.question: Why do small batches lead to faster completion and fewer errors?
options: Because smaller tasks require fewer people to manage
Because errors are caught immediately instead of accumulating until the end
Because customers prefer receiving products in smaller quantities
